dataset.title: Main Experiment: Leaf-litter inhabiting ants site A 2015

creator.organizationName: University of Freiburg, Chair of Nature Conservation and Landscape Ecology
Institute of Ecology and Environmental Chemistry, Section Ecosystem Functions, Leuphana University of Lueneburg

abstract.para: Under the canopy of 10 site A tree species (Castanea henryi, Castanopsis sclerophylla, Choerosbondias axillaris, Cunninghammia lanceolata, Cyclobalanopsis glauca, Liquidamber formosana, Lithocarpus glaber, Nyssa sinensis, Pinus massoniana, Schima superba) leaf litter ants were collected with Winkler extraction. The two coniferous species were only sampled in monocultures (no mixtures are planted), the remaining 8 tree species were sampled for the full gradient from 1 to 16 species mixtures. The data allow to test for the effect of tree species richness and tree species identity on leaf-litter ant diversity and community composition. As ants are colonial organisms, raw abundances should be analyzed with caution as the presence of single colonies with high worker numbers may bias abundances. The dataset is presented in long format. An R script to transform the dataset to wide format is given as an additional freeformat file (see below)

keywordSet.keywordThesaurus: Find the list of keywords here: http://china.befdata.biow.uni-leipzig.de/keywords
List of headers of the data columns in this dataset

intellectualRights.para: The data were collected during the master thesis of Merle Noack (merle.noack@gmx.de). Merle should be properly credited whenever the data are used.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Site A, BEF-China Main Experiment, near Xingangshan in Jiangxi province

taxonomicCoverage.generalTaxonomicCoverage: Formicidae (ants) extracted from the leaf litter

taxonomicClassification.commonName: Formicidae (ants) extracted from the leaf litter

description.para: Main Experiment: Leaf-litter inhabiting ants site A 2015

Under the canopy of 10 site A tree species (Castanea henryi, Castanopsis sclerophylla, Choerosbondias axillaris, Cunninghammia lanceolata, Cyclobalanopsis glauca, Liquidamber formosana, Lithocarpus glaber, Nyssa sinensis, Pinus massoniana, Schima superba) leaf litter ants were collected with Winkler extraction. The two coniferous species were only sampled in monocultures (no mixtures are planted), the remaining 8 tree species were sampled for the full gradient from 1 to 16 species mixtures. The data allow to test for the effect of tree species richness and tree species identity on leaf-litter ant diversity and community composition. As ants are colonial organisms, raw abundances should be analyzed with caution as the presence of single colonies with high worker numbers may bias abundances. The dataset is presented in long format. An R script to transform the dataset to wide format is given as an additional freeformat file (see below)
Site A, BEF-China Main Experiment, near Xingangshan in Jiangxi province
Formicidae (ants) extracted from the leaf litter

samplingDescription.para: Around each of the target tree individuals (column 'trees_ID') one leaf litter sample was take be sifting the entire litter in the 1*1 m square around the tree trunk (trunk was the center of the square). The sifted litter was filled in standard winkler bags and left for 48 h. Each of the 8 angiosperm tree species was sampled in tree plots of the diversity levels 1, 2, 4, 8, 16 with 4 individuals per plot, summing up to 480 samples. The two coniferous species were sampled with 4 individuals in the 5 commercial monocultures planted for the species, resulting in 40 samples. All ants were counted and identified to species or morphospecies.

dataTable.entityDescription: Main Experiment: Leaf-litter inhabiting ants site A 2015

attribute.attributeName: Plot name Main experiment (letter, number code) (PLOT_NO),
attribute.attributeDefinition: Plot number according to design spreadsheet. Plots are named according to their location on the original spreadsheet used for treatment design. This has letters from West to East and numbers from North to south. Some plots were moved half a gridcell (1 mu) so be suitable for planting (grid cell loctype). Example: B32 (PLOT_NO: Specific number of the plot sampled on Site A)

attribute.attributeDefinition: The scientific species fullnames are based on the "Flora of China" identified by Teng Fang and verified by Helge Bruelheide (trees) and Alexandra Erfmeier (herbs). Scientific species names consist of epithet and genus. For identification, the Author name and the year of the publications of the description are required. (tree_spec: Scientific name of the species under which the sample was collected)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Use as category (herb, litter, dead wood, open soil, rocks). With: herb = species occuring in the herb layer, i.e. below one metre in height, litter = total cover of litter, dead wood = total cover of dead wood including branches and twigs, open soil = total cover of open soil, i.e. soil without cover of litter, rocks = total cover of rocks, stones and rocks are recorded when considered to be a gap for plants. (litter cover: Estamated percentage of litter cover at the sampling position (in %))

description.para: Vegetation cover type

Use as category (herb, litter, dead wood, open soil, rocks). With: herb = species occuring in the herb layer, i.e. below one metre in height, litter = total cover of litter, dead wood = total cover of dead wood including branches and twigs, open soil = total cover of open soil, i.e. soil without cover of litter, rocks = total cover of rocks, stones and rocks are recorded when considered to be a gap for plants.
Estamated percentage of litter cover at the sampling position (in %)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Nominal taxon which has been assigned to a species(group). This does not reflect a real taxonomic instance but allows to differentiate certain taxonomic and/or functional instances across analyses that do not rely on detailed taxonomy. (morphospecies: morphospecies of the ants in the respective sample)
